article.description: Demon Brown made a pitch to get his starting job back, scoring a game-high 22 points to lead Charlotte to an 84-72 victory over South Florida on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Brown scores 22 in second game back
article.linkText: He's Demon: Charlotte cruises past S. Florida
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Guard Demon Brown made a pitch to get his starting job back, scoring a game-high 22 points to lead Charlotte to an 84-72 victory over South Florida on Wednesday night. Butter Johnson added 13 points and seven rebounds while Brendan Plavich chipped in 11 points for the 49ers (16-6, 8-3 Conference USA). Terrence Leather scored 19 points and Brandon Mosley 16 to lead South Florida (7-15, 1-10). Brown was held out of last Thursday night's game against Louisville after being arrested on charges on communicating threats against three people last week, losing his starting job to Mitchell Baldwin. This was Brown's second game back. He scored just three points in Charlotte's 46-45 loss to St. Louis on Saturday. But after Wednesday night's outing, Charlotte coach Bobby Lutz said he's considering reinserting Brown into the starting lineup Saturday night when the 49ers visit Southern Miss. "Fans worry about it more than I do because whether you are a starter or not, we need everybody ready to play," Lutz said. "Whether Demon starts or Mitchell starts, those guys are going to be important to us." Brown picked up the slack for Curtis Withers, the team's leading scorer. Withers failed to score in the game's first 35 minutes and tied a season-low with five points. He came into the game averaging 16.9 points and led Conference USA with 13 double-doubles. "Demon and Butter Johnson basically saved us tonight," Lutz said. Clearly, Brown hasn't been happy with coming off the bench. "I don't feel comfortable with it at all," Brown said. "But I had my problems and I had to come off the bench and deal with it. You've got to be ready to play." The 49ers looked like they were going to run away with Wednesday's game early on, building a 17-point lead midway through the first half behind three 3-pointers from Brown and some strong play on the offensive glass from Calvin Clemmons. But the Bulls battled back to cut the lead to five near the end of the first half behind the inside play of Leather and Gerrick Morris. The Bulls continued to chip away early in the second half, trimming the lead to two before Brown began to heat up again. Brown knocked down 3-pointers on consecutive possessions midway through the second half and finished 6 for 12 from beyond the 3-point arc. Charlotte has won five of its last six games.
